events-and-effects/effects.title: Effects
events-and-effects/effects.description: Effects are onChange callbacks triggered when certain rules are changed.

events-and-effects/events.title: Events
events-and-effects/events.description: Events can be attached either declaratively in React, or imperatively in vanilla JS.

events-and-effects/index.title: Effects & Events
events-and-effects/index.description: Finder offers two ways to attach side-effects to internal state changes.

index.title: ...why?
index.description: Do we really need a whole library for basic data manipulation? Maybe!

mixins/filters-mixin.title: Filters Mixin
mixins/filters-mixin.description: The Filters mixin can be accessed from finder.filters.

mixins/group-by-mixin.title: GroupBy Mixin
mixins/group-by-mixin.description: The GroupBy mixin can be accessed from finder.groupBy.

mixins/matches-mixin.title: Matches Mixin
mixins/matches-mixin.description: The Matches mixin can be accessed from finder.matches.

mixins/pagination-mixin.title: Pagination Mixin
mixins/pagination-mixin.description: The Pagination mixin can be accessed from finder.pagination.

mixins/search-mixin.title: Search Mixin
mixins/search-mixin.description: The Search mixin can be accessed from finder.search.

mixins/sort-by-mixin.title: SortBy Mixin
mixins/sort-by-mixin.description: The Sortby mixin can be accessed from finder.sortBy.

react/finder.title: Finder
react/finder.description: The root component, Finder accepts an armada of configuration properties and provides simplified context to consuming components.

react/finder-content.title: FinderContent
react/finder-content.description: FinderContent accepts a set of renderProps, and will determine the most appropriate state to display. Only a single state can be active at a time.

react/finder-search-term.title: FinderSearchTerm
react/finder-search-term.description: This handy component allows you to highlight the segments in your haystack that matched your searchTerm.

rules/filter-rule.title: FilterRule
rules/filter-rule.description: Define a filter predicate that will return a boolean for each item. If multiple filters are active, all filters must match for an item to be returned.

rules/index.title: Rules
rules/index.description: "Rules" are static definitions that tell Finder how to interact with the unique shape of your Items objects. Finder will use that information to determine what internal state to track.

rules/ruleset.title: FinderRuleset
rules/ruleset.description: Optional wrapper to ensures that an array of rules all have the correct shape.

rules/search-rule.title: SearchRule
rules/search-rule.description: Select strings from your items to search against

rules/sort-by-rule.title: SortByRule
rules/sort-by-rule.description: Only a single sortBy rule can be active at one time.
